solution_line_template: The old budget was ${old_budget} because {num_dodgeballs_old_budget} x {cost_per_dodgeball} = <<{num_dodgeballs_old_budget}*{cost_per_dodgeball}={old_budget}>>{old_budget}
They are adding ${budget_increase_amount} to the budget because {old_budget} x {budget_increase_percent} = <<{old_budget}*{budget_increase_percent}={budget_increase_amount}>>{budget_increase_amount}
They can buy {num_softballs} softballs on the new budget because {new_budget} / {cost_per_softball} = <<{new_budget}/{cost_per_softball}={num_softballs}>>{num_softballs}
